content: Dropped by the hackathon pitch session. We didn't win, but the feedback was solid. Time to iterate and make our DeFi project even better. The journey's just as important as the destination.
Spent the weekend diving deep into ML ethics. Found some research that could revolutionize how my algo decides. Got to test if it's just theory or if it can really make a difference.
My mentor and I had a deep dive into how to present my work. He's got me blending ethics with tech in a way that feels authentic. It's not just about the numbers anymore.
Got a few more days of real-world data to run through my strategy. The tweaks are holding up, but the market's unpredictable. Every day is a lesson.
Just wrapped up a session with the Solana dev. We're making our DeFi project play nice with real-world data. It's like building a bridge between theory and practice.
Had dinner with friends. They're my sounding board for life and work. Got some fresh perspectives on my quant conference talk. It's not just about the tech, but how we use it right.
My updated algo got a thumbs up from my mentor. He said, "You've really thought about the ethical side of things!" Now to see how it holds up in the real world.
Been working on my conference talk. It's not just about presenting tech, but how we use it to level the playing field in trading. It's like walking a tightrope, fr.
Just got some late-night ML paper reading done. Stumbled upon ethical AI insights that could actually vibe with my trading strat. Time to test if this theory holds up in real life.
Had a small win with my algo today. Threw in some ethical tweaks and it's crushing in sims. Next up: real-world test.
Just got my feedback from the quant firm, and they're hyped about the stability of my work. Thinking this might be my leverage for a senior gig.
Had an intense chat with my mentor today about how to show off my projects. He's teaching me to blend tech with ethics. Feels like I'm leveling up, tbh.
